text: Claudio Omar Turco García (born 24 August 1963 in Buenos Aires, Argentina) is an Argentine former international footballer who played as a winger. García started his professional career in 1981 with Club Atlético Huracán in Buenos Aires. He stayed with the club until their relegation from the Argentine Primera at the end of the 1985-1986 season. García joined Vélez Sársfield where he played until 1988, then signed for Lyon in France. In 1991 García returned to Argentine football to join Racing Club de Avellaneda. He was also given his debut for the Argentina national team in 1991. He was part of two Copa América winning campaigns in 1991 and 1993. García played over 100 games for Racing Club between 1991 and his departure in 1995. He joined Colón de Santa Fe where he spent one season before returning to Huracán in 1996. By the end of his second spell at Huracán he had made 251 appearances, scoring 51 goals. Towards the end of his playing days he spent time with All Boys and Independiente Rivadavia in the Argentine 2nd Division and Chacarita Juniors. In 2001, he joined Spanish lower league side Real Jaen. ==Coaching career== Since his retirement as a player García has worked as a football manager on a couple of occasions, with Defensores Unidos and Independiente Rivadavia. Currently, he is the manager of Talleres (RE). ==Honours== ===Player=== ====International==== Argentina *Copa América: 1991, 1993 *FIFA Confederations Cup: 1992 ==External links== * * Argentine Primera statistics Category:1963 births Category:Living people Category:Argentine footballers Category:Argentina youth international footballers Category:Argentina under-20 international footballers Category:Argentina international footballers Category:Sportspeople from Buenos Aires Category:1991 Copa América players Category:1992 King Fahd Cup players Category:1993 Copa América players Category:Copa América-winning players Category:FIFA Confederations Cup-winning players Category:Association football forwards Category:Argentine Primera División players Category:Club Atlético Huracán footballers Category:Club Atlético Vélez Sarsfield footballers Category:Olympique Lyonnais players Category:Racing Club de Avellaneda footballers Category:Club Atlético Colón footballers Category:All Boys footballers Category:Chacarita Juniors footballers Category:Independiente Rivadavia footballers Category:Real Jaén footballers Category:Argentine football managers Category:Independiente Rivadavia managers Category:Argentine expatriate footballers Category:Ligue 1 players Category:Expatriate footballers in France Category:Argentine expatriate sportspeople in France Category:Argentine expatriate sportspeople in Spain
title: Claudio García
